explanation: The 'index' function serves as the main route handler for the application.
It renders the 'index.html' template when the root URL is accessed.
This function is crucial for displaying the initial content to users.
response.hook: Explore the entry point of the application.
response.next_click: View the 'index.html' template to see the rendered output.
response.pitfall: Ensure that the 'index.html' template exists to avoid rendering errors.
response.title: ANY /
response.why_it_matters: Understanding this function is key to grasping how the application responds to user requests.
